intro: Sida florulenta, commonly known as the showy sida, is an herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with serrated edges, and it often grows in disturbed soils. Sida florulenta is typically found in open areas such as roadsides and fields, where it thrives in full sun.
